website_summaries.verdict: A gorgeous and efficient way to prevent bottom-dwelling and foraging aquatic reptiles from accidentally consuming smaller substrates, these large and naturally formed river pebbles arrive in a wide range of pretty colors and patterns. What will you get?
pros: Large and chunky pebbles make a convincing riverbed
Easy to disinfect, clean, and maintain
Aquatic turtles won’t consume the chunky pebbles
cons: Unfortunately, uneaten food may slip between the space between these larger river rocks

customer_reviews.title: Smooth large rocks that work well for my turtle's aquarium.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for a turtle aquarium. They're larger so your turtle doesn't end up eating any of them. When they first arrive they do need washed since they seem to come with a paper dust all over them. The colors of the rocks are very nice, having a natural look but still plenty of variety in the shades. I bought one bag for my 20 gallon aquarium and it works, but I'm picking up a second one since the first bag only covered a portion of the bottom of the tank. The rocks are all completely smooth too so your turtle can't injure themselves somehow on them. They work great!
customer_reviews.author: Where the Sidewalk Ends

customer_reviews.title: UPS Guy's face = priceless
customer_reviews.text: 10 pounds of smooth pebbles for $10, good deal and they're perfect for our turtle habitat. Yeah I guess you can get a bag at the dollar store, but for $1 you're gonna get 1 pound, and you're probably not going to be able to get 10 bags all at the same place (and if you need 50 pounds? Good luck). But perhaps the best part about ordering 5 bags from Amazon is the confused look on the UPS guy's face as he delivers a 50 pound litteral box of rocks to your door 😂.
customer_reviews.author: Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: A lot of pebbles for 10 gallon tank and don't slide!
customer_reviews.text: My friend has 3 small turtles in a 10 gallon tank and had too much water and only a floating fake rock. I bought these and a new Tetra 25845 Repto filter and set his tank up. Turtles love it!!!! These pebbles stay in place and turtles climb on them to rest.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Nice stones
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice stones. Beautiful assortment of colors and perfect size. Nothing too small so I don't have to worry about her ingesting any. I used 2 bags in a 45 gallon tank (36 x 12) and that was perfect for what I needed because I have large rocks on one side to secure the turtle dock. I would recommend at least 3, if not 4 bags in a tank of the same size if all you're using for a base is the stones.
customer_reviews.author: Artist

customer_reviews.title: The turtles love the new rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 packages to put a thin layer on the bottom of a 40 gal breeder tank (36" long x 18" wide with about 6-7" of water). They look great compared to the smaller black rock I used to have. The turtles do not try to eat the rocks (full grown, 13 year old turtles). The turtles love to dig in the rocks and seek out food - wish I had bought them years sooner because the turtles are obviously enjoying the new environment so much. They also make the tank appear "brighter". Some of the other reviews had me concerned - this was a great purchase for my turtles.
customer_reviews.author: J Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Not for 4"-5" Turtles like advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these bags. These were on the pricey side, considering I have seen 20lbs bags go for the price I paid for these. I gave theses a try because they were advertised to be for 4"-5" turtles like mine are. But I found myself picking out the smaller ones ones my turtles started to put them in their mouth. I did this about 5 times before I decided to take them out for good. They worked well for my goldfish, but I would recommend these for baby turtles only. These are pretty easy to clean, but they do accumulate quite a bit of gunk.
customer_reviews.author: Joli

customer_reviews.title: Great but has flaws
customer_reviews.text: I found some rocks broken in half with sharp edges, but there were only like 2 or 3 broken ones in 1 bag. I bought one bag and it filled my entire 10 gallon tank with about an inch of rocks, so if you have a 10 gallon tank I recommend buying at least 2 bags. The rocks look beautiful and not fake at all. They were also nicely polished.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Turdy loves the rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Turdy love the rocks. He's still only a little bigger than a quarter.... he uses the rocks to climb and bask, and he'll go into his little shell to blend in with the rocks when he wants to hide. Cleaned easily, I scrubbed them lightly with a soft brush and rinsed several times. Water in tank is clear. I used 1 and a half bags of the large rocks for a 10 gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: Marcey

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to eat
customer_reviews.text: These looked like great pebbles, but I returned them without using them. My turtle is a ravenous eater and I thought these pebbles would be big enough to deter him. He is a six inch turtle and some of the pieces were smaller than his head so I was worried that he would try to eat one and choke. These pebbles would look really good in a tank and they might work for you, but the product just didn't work for my situation
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Natural, CANNOT boil
customer_reviews.text: The rocks are natural and look great in my tank. The coating makes cleaning algae growth easier. I did notice that you cannot boil them. The coating on them seems to melt a bit with extreme heat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Swarthout

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful pebbles! Perfect for our turtles enclosure. Variety of colors and not too small.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Wood Batchelor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used these rocks for my tiger salamander's tank. When I brought him home he had changed from a water dog the day of! He still needed an area to swim around, but also that he could chill on above water. I have even found him burrowing under these rocks. They were a little dusty when I opened the bag, but they were super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Dutoit

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking rocks
customer_reviews.text: At the time I clicked on this product, the picture was wrong. It shows rocks that are much smaller than these large exo terra turtle pebbles. The ones I received were just right for my turtle tank. I bought 2 bags for my 29 gallon tank and they covered the bottom of the tank fine. Well, maybe three bags would cover it more thoroughly but I didn't want too thick a layer of rocks. They are really cool though. :) My turtle likes to dig around in them for any food that may have sunk to the bottom. The color of the rocks are cool too. They aren't just dark but have beige, brown, and gray too.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: 3 bags were perfect for my aquarium and they look great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful aquarium rocks
customer_reviews.text: I do not have a turtle but I bought these for my aquarium. They are beautiful, natural looking, and offer great value. The 10 pound bag fit the bottom of my 10 gal tank just perfectly. The rocks are also large and heavy so when you do a water change they do not get sucked up by the siphon! So happy I found these.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Best Aquarium Stones I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: These are the best aquarium stones I have ever used. They match my granite countertops perfectly, are semi-polished and smooth (except for two stones), and my baby Yellow Belly Slider is happy. Additionally, they arrive almost dust free. I recommend rinsing them in any case but they are fantastic. Finally, two ten pound bags is barely enough for a twenty gallon tank. If you want several layers stones, I suggest three or even four bags.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Takes some time to get them tank ready!
customer_reviews.text: Super SUPER dirty! When I first open the rocks I thought they were just kind of dusty, but as I started to rinse them tons of debris went into the water. I had to rinse these rocks forever until the water was clear! But other than that they are great rocks I've used them to weigh down aquatic plants in my turtle tank!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Very natural and large sea bed for your aquarium
customer_reviews.text: These are great in my 29G aquarium for a natural looking sea bed I used these with an underground filtration system and particles flow through and are filtered perfectly. Heavy rocks! Be careful putting them in a glass aquarium! :)
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: as expected
customer_reviews.text: as expected, had your basic large smooth stones with a few "unique" ones mixed in there too. pleased with purchase. ended up buying 5 bags. 3 to cover the bottom of my 75 GAL and two more to make the rock basking platform
customer_reviews.author: natelie

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought 3 bags
customer_reviews.text: I have a 44 gallon corner tank and 2 bags covered the bottom. Going to buy one more bag for better coverage so he can dig around like turtles do. Love the colors of the rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Amy and Billy

customer_reviews.title: Look great in my turtles aquarium
customer_reviews.text: Look great in my turtles aquarium, too big for him to eat but gives him a nice substrate to walk on instead of the smooth glass he was on before. I might order these for another aquarium because I just like the look of them
customer_reviews.author: Matt Olstad

customer_reviews.title: Dirty rocks
customer_reviews.text: The rocks were very dirty I had to soak them overnight and scrub them down. They still make the water very dirty. I wanted to return it but is would cost me more to return it then what I paid
customer_reviews.author: Ava P

customer_reviews.title: Funny turtles <3
customer_reviews.text: My turtles think they are in the wild...they try to look for stuff under the rocks and move them around, it's too cute. Later they end up eating their crap under the rocks... but It makes them happy so I'm happy !!
customer_reviews.author: sara a.

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for fish tanks
customer_reviews.text: Rocks advertised for aquariums are typically overpriced. These were much less and are of good quality. I used some in combination with fluorite for a planted aquarium. I like it very much!
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These are for the bottom of planters for my plants. Works for what I needed. Next time maybe do not pack them in the same box with items that can be broken tho. Was rather disappointed when I opened the box and the little hand mixer/milk frother box was beaten up. Thankful it worked.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynB

customer_reviews.title: My box and ybs love these
customer_reviews.text: My turtles are happy. These are much softer on their feet than gravel. My small box turtle has a hurt foot and when I switched to these from gravel she was walking all over her tank. She loves them
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Cute for my turtle tank, had to buy a few more bags because they didn't fill out as much as I thought they would. Very sturdy and heavy so my turtles cant just move them around easily.
customer_reviews.author: Grace McCollum

customer_reviews.title: They covered the bottom of my 10 gallon tank with ...
customer_reviews.text: They covered the bottom of my 10 gallon tank with no issues. Since the tank has a dock and some "plants", it's enough for me. Turtles seem to have no issue with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Lower grade rock. Many broken. Not like store bought bag of the same product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the quality of rocks received. Many many were broken and rough. I bought the exact same product from the local pet store and all were perfect. It seems like the bags being sold here are of a lower grade.
customer_reviews.author: toitle

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30 gallon tank, so I bought two bags and they laid out very nicely. I can't lie though I get scared when I clean my tank and put them back in because I think they're gonna break the glass. Not only that but they pull back on my cuticle when I'm taking them out, but they are smooth and dont harm my turtles.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a 10 gallon tank ... it is perfect ! Bag filled up the whole tank. Just make sure you wash the rocks out before placing in tank , they have dirt on them !
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Natural looking but really dirty
customer_reviews.text: They’re a good size for turtles and have nice natural colors but are really dirty and have to wash a lot and even after doing that they weren’t completely clean. Also the residue sticks on the tank’s glass
customer_reviews.author: Iruma

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 bags for 75gal. Overall a pretty good product. They are smooth and very nice looking. My turtles like to dig at the rocks and they are able to do so without causing complete chaos with the design.
customer_reviews.author: Jen P.

customer_reviews.title: Best quantity for quality in price range!
customer_reviews.text: Thus far, awesome product. We have an autistic foster child who is obsessed with all things under water. My wife and I decided on a turtle tank. We have a 40gallon long tank, 3 bags worked as just enough. I did soak them in bleach water for 15 min and thouroughly rinse and let fully air dry before putting them in the tank. Pictures will be added as soon as we have it all complete.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for turtles
customer_reviews.text: I really recommend these... the stones are really smooth, all different sizes and colors.
customer_reviews.author: Paula K Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Are these natural rocks?
customer_reviews.text: Good on first sight. the size is just right for the turtles that they won't try to eat it. Problem is the rocks fade and break down over time (1 month), make me wonder if they are true natural river rocks. Some of the dark colored ones show patches of transparent pink/white. half of the rocks now has cracks & holes on them. Couple broke down to small pieces as if it's made of bricks...
customer_reviews.author: Shylo

customer_reviews.title: I have a 10 gallon tank and they look great! There were some broken pieces but I threw ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 gallon tank and they look great! There were some broken pieces but I threw them away after cleaning them before adding them to my tank.
customer_reviews.author: Tory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! My turtle loves them
customer_reviews.text: My turtle loves these rocks! The previous owner was using cheap fish pebbles and my turtle I noticed would try to eat them. so as soon as i found these i knew I needed them they are just the right size for my turtle and I notice he’s a lot happier because he can move around a lot better I used about a bag and a half of these to fill the bottom of my tank perfectly! Extremely pleased with these rocks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I liked the rocks but it is a pain in the butt to clean, I soaked for 15 minutes and washed and washed and washed, thought I got all residue off, nope, made my tank very stinky (I had run my filter over night and didn’t put my turtles in it) now my water is cloudy and just pain in my butt now! Probably won’t order again!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Todd

customer_reviews.title: Rocks
customer_reviews.text: Used to fill tank on one side for drying off the turtle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Wish we had more
customer_reviews.text: We love these. We wish we'd added more in our setup. Our plecos seem to like hanging on here as well.
customer_reviews.author: KBJA Field

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colored rocks for almost half the price of local ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for sons axolotl tank. Beautiful colored rocks for almost half the price of local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, exactly as advertised, will be perfect for my turtles
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Smith

customer_reviews.title: Natural and Necessary
customer_reviews.text: Pretty rocks, they are covered with slider poop now and ready to be replaced. Can i get another round please!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Valent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my needs and much cheaper than at the pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Casices

customer_reviews.title: Turtle approved
customer_reviews.text: These smooth pebbles are great, but they do break down over time, and some are magnets for algae growth. However, that can be avoided with a minimal increase in care. My turtle definitely appreciates them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good amount
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10gl and it was good for it but anything bigger and you might need more begs
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Avila

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition for my turtle tank...looks great and creates a nice environment for my Turtle
customer_reviews.text: The Exo Terra Turtle Pebbles are a great addition to my turtle tank. They look really nice and because they are the real thing they make our turtle's enviroment genuine and eco friendly in appearance and environmental safety. The turtle seems to really like them too...he often swims down to move the pebbles to get his food that sank to the bottom...and, he sit down there a lot too...I think he likes the feel of the soft, rounded stones and pebbles on his underside...! ...??? I'll probably be getting more of these when I move my turtle to a larger tank. I recommend these to anyone for turtles, fresh water fish or other critters. PWN.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great turtle pebbles
customer_reviews.text: Great pebbles. Not quite enough for my 20 gal. tank, but I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Old hen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Look very nice in the tank, help keep the tank look orderly. Will definitely order more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JainaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Rocktastic
customer_reviews.text: For rocks them simply rock! After a few minutes of rinsing the rocks in a strainer they were ready for the aquarium. they look great in the aquarium a good mix of colors and all nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Good, Sort of
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my RES turtle that is 7-8" long. She hated them. But she has always been strange. If your turtle don't mind them, then they are a good find, but if you have one like mine that hates having things in her tank, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are so beautiful and polished
customer_reviews.text: These are so beautiful and polished! My turtles love them and have been playing around in them since I've added them to their tank! I am going to have to order some more.
customer_reviews.author: Dare

customer_reviews.title: Rinse rocks two to three times
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rocks but take a couple rinses to remove debris
customer_reviews.author: Brown91

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My turtle really like these instead of rocks I had in aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pebbles perfect for aquarium to give a natural look!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking rocks. Will need two bags for a tank 29 gallons or larger.
customer_reviews.author: Sam McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the rocks I would call them medium size. I would like to note that the colors do not really match the pictures. They are a lot more brown/white and natural looking then the darker greys and blues shown in the picture. That was okay with me because that matches the color scheme in my aquarium better but if I was specifically looking for darker colored rocks I would probably have given these 2 or 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect turtle rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: The rocks are great. Heavy box! Lol box of rocks!! They are clean, and the size I expected. They are absolutely perfect for a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie07

customer_reviews.title: Great for turtles.
customer_reviews.text: These look great in my turtle tank.i will but again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Wack

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to go in my turlte's tank. They are perfect size so the turtle can't try to eat them. I would and probably will order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Kahl

customer_reviews.title: smaller than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I mean it says Large but they aren't really i guess if you consider a pebble being a chip but really smaller than anticipated
customer_reviews.author: Neospell

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful natural rocks
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful stones. They look so lovely in my turtle tank and the Amazon price beats any fish store for sure!! (Paid $17 a bag at PETCO). However, you could go to Home Depot and buy a large bag from the garden section of river rocks for $4.xx a bag and it's about 5 times the size of these. For a small tank I would recommend definitely but if going larger l, try bulk at a home improvement or landscaping place...just wash them with water very very well first!
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Quality sucks
customer_reviews.text: Some rocks are cracked and sharp. Not good for little water turtles
customer_reviews.author: LeoValenz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Great for our Red Earred Sliders who cannot have bottom gravel substrate (substrate is important & rocks should be no small than what these turtles could possibly eat, swallow, or become lodged between skin and shell).
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Olson

customer_reviews.title: Nice and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Very clean pebbles, only needed to rinse it. Nice and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lin

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but it's too hard to clean. I tried cleaning the rocks with a gravel cleaner, but it doesn't work. The only way to get them clean is to remove them from the terrarium and wash them by hand
customer_reviews.author: T. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought two bags for my 29 gallon tank fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one bag for a 20 gallon tank and it made a nice even layer. Will definitely be buying another bag to add a deeper bed of pebbles to bury plants and such. A little noisy, but very aesthetically pleasing. My only complaint is I wish they were more clear on how to clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Some pebbles were quite small, i had to take ...
customer_reviews.text: Some pebbles were quite small, i had to take them out of the bunch so my turtle wouldn't accidentally swallow it. Also, took a lot of washing, the water turned murky white and rinsed it so many times.
customer_reviews.author: mayumi

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Mostly round, was hoping for more variety. The turtle seems to love them though
customer_reviews.author: Failte Acres

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rocks!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to put in the tank for a turtle that we are baby siting for awhile. His tank had the small multicolored rocks which I found out are not the best for Red Eared Slider Turtles, so I purchased these. He loves them and will push them around while "playing"!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not great for turtles
customer_reviews.text: I would not advise using these with turtles. Food tends to get stuck in between the rocks and the only way to really clean is to take all of the rocks out and scrub which is a very big job if you are using a 20 gallon tank...
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: These rocks are beautiful for my aquarium . The stones Are huge which makes it easier to clean the tank with c:
customer_reviews.author: Jonnie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with my purchase. They are big enough that my turtle can't eat them. They bring a more natural feel to the tank. I bought two 10 pound bags for my 40 gallon breeder tank 36x18. It covered the bottom except for a couple bare spots. I'm going to buy 1 more bag. Just like any other rock or gravel they need to be rinsed very well. I placed the rocks in the bathtub with hot water and shook /moved them around for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice big rocks to keep critters from eating them
customer_reviews.text: Nice big rocks to keep critters from eating them. Some are pretty cool looking. I ended up needing just shy of two bags to adequately cover the bottom of a 10-gallon tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with these rocks! They are all very ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these rocks! They are all very smooth and mixed in the basic browns there were some very unique colors and patterns. Will purchase these again
customer_reviews.author: Erin E

customer_reviews.title: ok if you have a larger turtle
customer_reviews.text: They're a little too large for my little turtle, so next time I'll get the medium. Have to really rinse them before use, because they're very dirty/dusty when you receive them.
customer_reviews.author: ChristinaP

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The pebbles work great for our turtle we ordered 3 bags for a 55 gallon tank
customer_reviews.author: Diana Carrera

customer_reviews.title: Happy Turtle!
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described. Perfect for larger turtles. Nice natural assortment of colors as pictured. Looks great in tank. Not much pre-cleaning required.
customer_reviews.author: Janette P

customer_reviews.title: USELESS
customer_reviews.text: Please don't waste your money on these pebbles....very difficult keep clean and keep clean.....save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Very natural looking, tons of beautifully colored stones!
customer_reviews.text: They were beautifully colored, very natural looking, and all of them were different shapes, sizes and colors!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Good. My turtles don't eat it, and they like to hide their poops underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great product for turtle tank
customer_reviews.text: Safe size for turtles Good mixture of colors You need at least 2 pack for 20G-Long tank
customer_reviews.author: oaltinok

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what expected however
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected but is a little over priced. Went to Menards and bought rock for 2.49 for 10 pounds
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: made cage way to hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: with the rocks in my tank it was horrible to try to keep clean. I have turtles and the rocks had my water cloudy in 2 days I took them out and my tank is a lot cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: teresa salazar

customer_reviews.title: Would be a great product if aquatic turtles weren't difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Would be a great product if aquatic turtles weren't difficult to clean, the rocks made it hard for my turtle to walk on.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size, smaller than you think. Turtle loves to flip them all day long, lol!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto F.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: for a 10 gallon tank you need 2 bags of these to cover the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: camachohead

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These matched the stones I had in my tank perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: my turtle loves his new home
customer_reviews.text: what a difference these rocks make in the tank! went from boring to a brand new "crib" love them..
customer_reviews.author: Robin Wallett

customer_reviews.title: Turtle seems to be satisfied. Pebbles are smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Turtle seems to be satisfied. Pebbles are smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra P D Bushnell

customer_reviews.title: Great service all around!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the delivery service and product very much. Was on time with in the window and had updates. Will use again thanks !
customer_reviews.author: Miguel lopez

customer_reviews.title: Pond rocks, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Not too big and not to small. Perfect size for my turtles. provides a natural feel to any aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great rocks with a good variety of shapes/sizes/colors, safe for turtle
customer_reviews.text: These definitely spice up the turtle cage while being easy to manage/safe. The only things I didn't like is that despite washing them, my aquarium was heavily clouded for over a day after putting in.. Also, it is easy to put in too much....two bags is more than enough for a 36"x18" breeder tank. Also, when piled against each other - there isn't that much space for ghost shrimp/other small fish to hide...the rock shapes are all relatively smooth which is good for the turtle but means that the rocks can really fit in tightly against each other.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Marlowe

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Inspect before use
customer_reviews.text: Please be sure to inspect and clean these rocks properly as I found a cigarette butt in one of the 3 bags I ordered. Otherwise though they are good rocks and fairly inexpensive !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size of the rocks and it looks great but had to rinse it off very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Turtle seems happy. Will order again need more rocks.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer quinonez

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rocks to add Decor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 bags for a 20 Gallon tank. I already had some rocks in there. I think 3 bags would be good for a 20 Gallon tank. They are just rocks but definitely add decor to my turtle tank. My turtle enjoys picking at them too.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Colasuonno

customer_reviews.text: Not bad rocks for the turtle, not too happy though. I bought two of these and the color is way way off. Not really matching my setup how I was planning.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

product_meta.title: Exo Terra Turtle Pebbles, Large
product_meta.description: Exo Terra turtle pebbles are smooth river pebbles that have rounded over time in fast moving rivers. The smooth pebbles prevent injury to bottom dwelling or foraging turtles. The variations of colours and patterns create a natural looking riverbed. Round pebbles 5/9-inch to 5/8-inch, perfect for turtles with a shell diameter of 4-inch or more. Easy to clean and re-use. Soak and disinfect pebbles by placing them in a large bucket of water for 15 minutes. Rinse until all of the visible particles are removed and the water runs clean. Comes in pack of 2. Available in 10-pound plastic pack with large size.
feature_bullets: The smooth pebbles prevent injury to bottom dwelling or foraging turtles
The variations of colours and patterns create a natural looking riverbed
Round pebbles 0.3-0.4-inch, perfect for turtles with a shell diameter of 4-inch or more
Available in 10-pound plastic pack with large size
